title: What year was the first car dashboard radio introduced? - Quora

response.answer_text: Marconi made a mobile telegraph in 1901, and in 1904, Lee de Forest demonstrated the first car radios. The first radios to be installed in cars were in the 1920s. A few years later Paul Galvin created a more affordable car radio, his invention was the foundation of Motorola which made then much more popular: Vehicle audio - Wikipedia this is a little more thorough: History of obsolete car audio, part 1: Early radio The Motorola radio had a steering column mounted head unit, so that might be your answer. The German standard DIN 75490 for in-car radio head units was published in 1979 and adopted in 1984 as ISO 7736. This made radio units easily interchangeable.
